page.title: 02MORRIS DANCING
page.content: Morris dancing is dancing to music. Some times we use sticks and sometimes hankies. You wear a kind of cape with a white shirt. You can do it with six or eight people. Each person has his or her partner opposite them so you dance in two parallel lines. You hit your partners stick which we call clashing, and sometimes you hit the ground. With hankies you whirl them round and clap your hands. On the 4th of December 1984 we went over to Paignton College with lots of other schools. Our team consists of Clare, Emma, Nicola, Marcus, Graham and me. We did a dance called "In an English Country Garden." We are hoping to do some more this summer with lots of people watching us. ALASTAIR TEAGUE
